title: Protocol to image deuterated propofol in living rat neurons using multimodal stimulated Raman scattering microscopy
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Loading neurons
Timing: 45 min
Optional: For better identification of
      cells, neurons may be loaded with fluorescent dyes. Calcein AM was chosen
      in this protocol to identify the cells' cytoplasm and thereby their
      morphologies.
    
        Staining neurons with fluorescent dyes
        
            Dilute 5 mM calcein AM stock to a final working concentration of
            100 nM in HEPES ACSF.
          
            Load cells with 100 nM calcein AM in HEPES ACSF for 30 min at 37°C
            in 5% CO2 incubator.
          
            After loading, wash cells in fresh HEPES ACSF and transfer to 35 mm
            glass base dish (IWAKI) with 3 mL of HEPES ACSF.
          
Critical: Calcein AM is sensitive to
      hydrolysis. Calcein AM-containing aqueous working solutions should be made
      shortly before use and used within one day.
    
Critical: The concentration of calcein
      AM and the incubation time are strictly controlled since relatively high
      concentrations of calcein AM can be toxic to cells, especially neurons;
      low concentrations of calcein AM can also lead to difficulties in
      observation.
    
        Check cells with conventional microscope
        
            After staining is complete, use fluorescence microscope to assess
            staining of neurons.
          
Note: Wait 15–60 minutes to allow for AM
      ester removal if fluorescence color presentation is insufficient for cell
      identification.
    
Observation of propofol in living neurons
Timing: 1 h
        Detection of propofol-d17 signal
        
            Align the two lasers to maximize the SRS signals using
            alkyne-containing standard sample (alkyne-estrogen).
          
            Just before imaging, add propofol-d17 to the cell culture dish to
            make a final concentration of 100 μM.
          
            Place the dish on the sample stage and prepare for observation.
            
Optional: If the system is
              equipped with single photon confocal microscopy, turn it on,
              illuminate cells with 488 nm laser, locate the cells with the
              fluorescence of calcein AM.
            
            After checking the safety of the optical line, open a shutter for

pump and Stokes lasers, run program to start the experiment.
          
            Referring to the two-photon microscope channel, adjust the bottom
            objective lens to position the cell again.
          
Check the signal of the SRS channel.
            If the objective lens is equipped with correction collar, adjust it
            to maximize the SRS signal.
            
Note: Although SRS signals do not
              bleach, fluorescence signals may be susceptible to bleaching with
              high intensity lasers used for SRS imaging.
            
            Adjust the number of frame and average according to the strength of
            the signal and acquire the image (Figure 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig5]).
            
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2579-Fig5.jpg
                  Figure 5. Representative images of multimodal multiphoton
                  imaging of primary cultured neurons
                
                  SRS signals of propofol-d17 at 2055 cm−1 (A) and
                  two-photon excited fluorescence of calcein AM (B) can be
                  acquired simultaneously.
                
Note: Frame averaging result in
              acquisition of images with better signal to noise ratio but
              reduces temporal resolution.
            
        Confirmation of the signal of propofol-d17
        
            Set the pump wavelength to make the wavenumber below
            2,000 cm−1, off-resonance wavenumber of propofol-d17.
          
Obtain the image in the same frame averaging setting.
            Compare images under on- and off-resonance pulses to confirm the
            signal of propofol-d17.
          
Data analysis
      Fiji was used to analyze the intensity distribution of the SRS signals,
      which can further confirm the location of propofol-d17 on neuron.
    
Measuring dynamics of propofol by washout experiment
Timing: 3 h (for steps 6 and 7)
    
      High sensitivity and low toxicity of multimodal multiphoton system allows
      characterization of the spatiotemporal dynamics of propofol. For this
      purpose, a perfusion system was used to wash away propofol-d17 on the
      neuronal culture while monitoring SRS signals.
    
        Washout experiments
        
            Using the loaded neuronal cells described above, choose a target
            cell for timelapse imaging.
          
            Perform a timelapse imaging for a total 1,000 frames while perfusing
            of 3 mL 100 μM propofol-d17 solution with fresh HEPES ACSF solution

(Figure 6[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig6]).
            
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2579-Fig6.jpg
                  Figure 6. SRS image before (left) and after (right) exchange
                  of propofol-d17 with fresh HEPES ACSF on hippocampal neuron
                
                  Reduction in the SRS signal intensity of propofol-d17 at
                  2055 cm−1 at somatic regions (blue and red boxes)
                  after washout can be seen.
                
Optional: Use ImageJ (Fiji) to process
      the data, make a composite image, and group every 20 images to get a
      time-lapse image set and perform mathematical analysis.
    
Optional: Alternatively, a set of 1000
      frames can be obtained during the washout of 3 mL 100 μM propofol-d17 with
      fresh 100 μM of regular (non-deuterated) propofol on the same kind of
      neuronal cells.
    
        Data Analysis
        
Note: The microscope system can
          acquire data from four channels at the same time as photodetectors can
          be equipped with a bandpass filter to detect various signals. In this
          experiment, two main signal channels are used i.e., SRS signal and
          two-photon excited fluorescence signal are acquired simultaneously, in
          which the two-photon excited fluorescence image is used as a guide to
          identify the location of cells.
        
            Choose the region of interest for analysis (cell body in the example
            shown in Figure 7[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig7]).
            
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2579-Fig7.jpg
                  Figure 7. Changes of SRS signals upon washout of propofol-d17
                
                  Intensity profiles of SRS signals from two different neurons
                  after washout of propofol-d17.
                
            Use appropriate software (e.g., Fiji) to analyze the SRS
            channels' signal changes.
          
            Plot intensity of propofol-d17 SRS signal intensity against time to
            visualize timecourse of SRS signal changes upon washout (Figure 7[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig7]).
